snippet: President Hugo Chávez’s health crisis and decision to proceed on Thursday with a quasi-presidential inauguration that he is unable to attend is producing national angst about who is in charge.
abstract: President Hugo Chavez’s deteriorating health and his decision to proceed with a quasi-presidential inauguration that he is unable to attend is producing stream of bizarre developments and national angst about who is in charge of Venezuela.

byline.contributor: María Iguarán and María Eugenia Díaz contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Hugo Chávez’s health crisis and decision to proceed on Thursday with a quasi-presidential inauguration that he is unable to attend is producing national angst about who is in charge.

headline.seo: Would-Be Inauguration in Venezuela for Chávez
headline.main: Chávez, or at Least His Sash, Is Set for Venezuela Inauguration
headline.print_headline: Chávez, or at Least His Sash, Is Set for Venezuela Inauguration
